Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Job Description

What you get to do in this role:

The Advanced Technology Group (ATG) at ServiceNow is a customer-focused innovation group building intelligent software and smart user experiences using existing and latest advanced technologies to enable end-to-end, industry-leading work experiences for customers. We are a group of researchers, applied scientists, engineers, and product managers with a dual mission. We build and evolve the AI platform, and partner with teams to build products and end-to-end AI-powered work experiences. In equal measure, we lay the foundations, research, experiment, and de-risk AI technologies that unlock new work experiences in the future.

You will play a major part in building AI and Machine Learning (ML) solutions that transform the user experience and workflow efficiency of enterprise services. Traditional analytical tools tend to require a technically knowledgeable user to produce even simple results. We are taking a completely fresh approach with the expectation that any user, regardless of technical knowledge, can use the AI/ML solutions we develop to operate the services in the enterprise setting in a thoughtful and scalable manner. We are just getting started with our early-adopter customers and we need your help in building and making available an amazing range of solutions to our 5k+ enterprise customers around the world.

Build the best cloud-based AI/ML solutions to power intelligent enterprise services.
Collaborate daily with a team of like-minded developers, product managers and quality engineers to produce quality software.
Work with product owners to understand detailed requirements and own your code from design, implementation, testing and delivery of high-quality solutions to our users.

Qualifications

To be successful in this role you have:

Typically requires a minimum of related experience, or equivalent work experience.
Expertise in Java or Python, OOP, Design Patterns, time and space-efficient algorithms.
Experience building new products that use challenging algorithms.
Expertise in coding efficient, object-oriented, modularized and quality software.
Knowledge of core AI/ML techniques and algorithms.
Knowledge of unit testing, profiling, and code tuning.

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $158,500 - $269,500, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

Additional Information

Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

The Enterprise Data Scientist applies advanced data science techniques, with a specific emphasis on AI-driven and generative AI solutions, to transform enterprise operations across UCSF. This role involves analyzing large and complex datasets from diverse enterprise systems—including HR, finance, supply chain, research, and administrative domains—to drive strategic insights, improve operational efficiency, and support institutional decision-making.

The Enterprise Data Scientist collaborates with business, clinical, and technical stakeholders to identify key performance indicators, develop predictive models, AI tools, and LLM-powered solutions, and implement data-driven strategies that align with UCSF’s mission. This includes developing, validating, and deploying machine learning models and generative AI analytics while ensuring data governance, reliability, and compliance with security best practices.

The role requires expertise in deploying and operationalizing Large Language Models and integrating generative AI into enterprise workflows. Candidates should have experience working with statistical techniques, AI frameworks (e.g., OpenAI API, LangChain, vector databases), and developing predictive models into complex operational environments. The ideal candidate will have strong programming skills (Python, R, SQL, JavaScript, etc.), be familiar with programming with APIs, and possess experience with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) and enterprise data platforms such as ERP and financial reporting systems. Effective communication skills are essential, as the Enterprise Data Scientist must translate complex technical analyses into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The final salary and offer components are subject to additional approvals based on UC policy.

Your placement within the salary range is dependent on a number of factors including your work experience and internal equity within this position classification at UCSF. For positions that are represented by a labor union, placement within the salary range will be guided by the rules in the collective bargaining agreement.

The salary range for this position is $143,900 - $200,000 (Annual Rate).

To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html

Department Description

The Enterprise Information and Analytics (EIA) department at UCSF plays a critical role in advancing the institution’s mission by enhancing access to and the use of data, analytics, and artificial intelligence. As part of UCSF’s Information Technology department, EIA is responsible for organizing, integrating, governing, and transforming UCSF’s data assets to support informed decision-making across the university’s clinical, research, education, and administrative domains.

EIA serves as the strategic link between UCSF’s clinicians, researchers, educators, and administrators and the technical resources needed to deliver impactful data solutions. By translating complex data into meaningful insights, EIA enables informed decision-making, fosters innovation, and drives positive change across the institution.

EIA also manages and supports UCSF’s Versa AI platform, a cutting-edge generative AI solution that enhances access to knowledge, streamlines workflows, and improves efficiency across UCSF’s mission areas. By integrating artificial intelligence, data governance, and advanced analytics, EIA empowers UCSF to care, heal, teach, and discover in an increasingly data-driven world.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field / or equivalent experience/training
4+ years of experience in positions working with large datasets and conducting statistical and quantitative modeling, including programming, data mining, clustering, and segmentation.
Expertise in data analytics, documentation, and reporting, including the ability to apply metrics, design and run queries, collect and analyze performance data, and produce sophisticated reports and analyses for enterprise decision-making.
Ability to serve as a technical leader and advisor, collaborating with senior staff and management across departments to provide insights on policy, functionality, system efficiency, upgrades, business analytics, and industry trends.
Strong interest in working with administrative, HR, finance, research, and education data, and understanding the challenges that face complex organizations and data-driven decision-making processes.
Broadly encompassing and highly in-depth knowledge of machine learning and the deployment of predictive analytics in operational environments. Knowledge of data workflows, user interface optimization, decision support, rules development, data integration and mining, ontologies, and adoption of technology.
Strong data and statistical programming skills, including proficiency in Python, R, SQL, or other tools used for data manipulation, modeling, and visualization, along with experience working with data warehouses and enterprise analytics platforms.
Highly organized with the ability to prioritize tasks and lead projects from inception to completion on schedule.
Advanced interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to convey highly technical information to diverse stakeholders, provide technical support, and develop and deliver training materials.
Ability to apply advanced problem-solving and analytical skills to complex issues, quickly diagnose challenges, and develop, test, and implement effective solutions in a timely manner.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree or doctorate in computer science or related area.
Prior experience with enterprise resource planning (ERP) data, HR, financial, research, or education-related analytics systems.

About UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

positionName: Reports Engineer/Fledgling Data Scientist – Poly Clearance Required!
description:
Reports Engineer/Fledgling Data Scientist – Poly Clearance Required!

Praxis is a prime contractor performing on a High Performance Computing (HPC) contract in support of a restricted customer and a select mission partners. This contract provides advanced computing capabilities for executing scientific, data science and AI/ML workloads. The team provides infrastructures to enables innovation in support of high fidelity, advanced analytics and model development by delivering the highest quality technical capabilities, cutting edge computing and engineering support to its customers.

The infrastructure delivers a state-of-the-art solution comprised of hardware, software, storage and networking as well as application, database and workstation support. The program supports an advanced computing infrastructure containing clustered GPUs and massively parallel CPU to enable the delivery of high fidelity, advanced analytic products. This environment provides unprecedented access to computational power and analytic throughput to solve some of the government’s most challenging computational and scientific problems.

What you will be doing

The team needs to understand the performance characteristics of its complex infrastructure and to quantify how our users exercise this platform. To do this, we need to pull and groom data from systems and logs that categorize key attributes of the platform from visualization and analysis. These views of holistic system use inform actions the team will undertake to optimize the systems and inform future investments.

The successful candidate is responsible for creating visualizations, reports and dashboards for use by management for monitoring and decision making. This role will require learning the needs of the environment and how it can be serviced by curating data for consumption as insightful visual artifacts. This will require developing or building on data science and visualization techniques to deliver easy to understand data represented as online and on display dashboards.

As the role grows, the candidate will expand the work to include acquiring requirements to improve the team’s delivery of HPC hardware and software tools for its mission partners performing data science, complex physics-based modeling, and AI/ML efforts. The candidate will work with the HPC team, the system administration teams, and the users of the delivered capabilities to create the future environment supporting our growing user base. It is expected that this role expands over time to participate in, or take on complex tasks, to increase the usefulness of the infrastructure being supplied as the team approaches nascent disciplines related to emerging field such as MLOps, LLM integrations, AI enabled services, etc.

Day to day this position will be called upon to both work within the defined field of generating these various report and dashboards, while also working with the larger team to leverage all the candidates’ capabilities to meet mission requirements.

What you will need
Experience in software development to write code and scripts to curate data and develop visualizations. (API/ETL)
Hands on experience with software and scripting languages resulting in delivered code. (Python, JavaScript, etc.)
Knowledge of data science techniques to address the immediate desires of delivering visualizations and dashboard, with a plan to grow into more complex machine learning operations to enable future systems operations insights.
Experience capturing requirements.
Comfortable in a fast-moving environment.
Ability to self-start and manage deadlines to completion.
A strong curiosity to learn emerging capabilities with an ability to work with the team to set and realize our future vision.
The drive and desire to lean into creating new, difference making capabilities.
A team orientation.

Clearance
Active TS/SCI with an appropriate polygraph is required to be considered for this role

Salary range:
$79,560.00 - $175,074.00 (Annually)*

Req ID: PRX-25-678

Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Design, develop, implement, test, and maintain Generative AI models and agentic workflows using GCP Vertex AI, AWS Bedrock, and Snowflake Cortex.

Build and integrate Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, to ground the responses of AI solutions with up-to-date and relevant data.

Fine-tune and evaluate foundation models using both proprietary and open-source technology.

Develop agentic architectures using tools like LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen, and others to orchestrate multi-step reasoning, planning, and tool use.

Build and optimize AI agents that can interface with MCP servers, APIs, databases, take contextual actions, and autonomously execute business workflows.

Collaborate closely with data scientists, data engineers, and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.

Implement best practices for model deployment, monitoring, validation, and retraining on GCP Vertex AI, AWS Bedrock, and Snowflake Cortex.

Work with cross-functional IT and business teams in an Agile environment to deliver successful AI solutions.

Document processes, models, and configurations for knowledge sharing and compliance.

Stay current with the latest in generative AI research and translate breakthroughs into applied business solutions

Must Haves:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

4+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, with a focus on Generative AI.

Proficiency in programming languages such as Python

Strong understanding of Generative AI models (e.g., GPT, Transformer architectures) and experience in distilling, tuning and training them.

Familiarity with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques and their implementation.

Experience with agentic AI concepts and developing autonomous AI workflows.

Hands-on experience with GCP Vertex AI, AWS Bedrock + Sagemaker, and Snowflake Cortex platforms and their AI/ML capabilities..

Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers).

Experience with AI frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen, etc.

Experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and building conversational AI agents.

Experience with vector databases (eg. Pinecone, MongoDB Atlas, OpenSearch, pgVector, FAISS, Qdrant, etc)

Experience building production-grade AI/ML systems at scale.

Knowledge of MLOps practices, including model deployment and lifecycle management.

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Bonus Attributes:

Familiarity with Prompt Engineering, RLHF, and model evaluation techniques.

Understanding of AI governance, safety, and responsible principles.

Understanding of reinforcement learning and its application in agentic AI.

Familiarity with big data technologies (Apache Spark, Kafka)

Experience with CI/CD tools and automation for AI/ML workflows.

Familiarity with Snowflake’s cloud integrations.

Experience with real-time data processing and streaming analytics.

Publications or contributions to open-source projects in the AI/ML field.

Abilities:

Ability to work proactively with a high level of initiative and accuracy.

Ability to manage multiple assignments effectively and meet established deadlines.

Strong interpersonal skills to interact professionally with staff and stakeholders.

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

Critical thinking ability ranging from moderately to highly complex tasks.

Flexibility in adapting to changing business needs and priorities.

Ability to work creatively and independently with minimal supervision.

Ability to utilize experience and judgment in accomplishing goals.

Experience in navigating organizational structures and collaborating across teams.

Travel Required: 2%

Physical Demands:

Standing/ Walking – minimal level

Sitting – moderate to high level

Lifting – up to 15 lbs.

Visual Concentration – high level

Work Environment – typical office environment.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work: Full Time

Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future.

Department Overview
A smarter store starts with smarter communication. Theatro, our user-friendly, voice-driven AI platform provides retail workers with real-time, discreet, and efficient communication — helping them stay safe and productive while delivering top-notch customer service.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with strong machine learning expertise and a hands-on mindset to lead our data initiatives. This individual should be a self-starter who can proactively explore our data, identify impactful opportunities, and drive solutions independently. The ideal candidate will not just execute on business requests but will also shape our data strategy by telling us what we should be doing with the data we have.

Key Responsibilities

Take full ownership of the data science and ML stack from the ground up, including tooling and infrastructure decisions.

Proactively analyze available data to identify business opportunities and recommend ML/AI strategies accordingly.

Drive the complete ML lifecycle: problem definition, data exploration, feature engineering, model development, deployment, and monitoring.

Deliver hands-on ML solutions across various domains (e.g., forecasting, churn prediction, optimization).

Communicate actionable insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Partner with leadership and cross-functional teams to prioritize high-impact data initiatives.

Stay current with advancements in ML/AI and continuously bring innovation into our workflows.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.

5+ years of hands-on experience building and deploying data science and machine learning models.

Proven ability to work independently and drive projects from idea to impact.

Expert in Python and SQL; strong experience with libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, and ML frameworks.

Familiarity with modern BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).

Deep understanding of ML and statistical methods: regression, classification, forecasting, optimization, A/B testing.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders.

Target Base Salary Range: $90,000 - $144,000 USD

Job Title

Staff AI Operator

Job Description

About The Position | Major goals and objectives and location requirements
Dotdash Meredith is seeking an AI Operator to join our AI Strategy team. Reporting to the VP of AI Strategy and collaborating closely with the VP of Editorial AI, this role focuses on designing and implementing agentic AI systems that are deeply integrated into our business processes. The ideal candidate will act as a business process engineer, leveraging generative AI solutions to enhance and automate workflows across editorial, product, and engineering domains.
DDM remains committed to producing only human-authored content across all of our brands.

Remote-
In-office Expectations: This position is fully remote with no in-office requirements, (might require coming into an office 1 or 2x a year)
About The Positions Contributions:
Process Analysis & Optimization: Evaluate existing business processes to identify opportunities for AI integration, aiming to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

Agentic System Development: Design, develop, and deploy AI agents that can autonomously perform tasks within defined parameters, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

Low-Code Implementation: Utilize low-code platforms to build and maintain AI-driven solutions, enabling rapid deployment and iteration.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams across editorial, product, and engineering to understand their workflows and tailor AI solutions that meet their specific needs.

Monitoring & Evaluation: Establish metrics to assess the performance of AI agents, ensuring they deliver the intended outcomes and continuously improve over time.

Documentation & Training: Create comprehensive documentation for developed AI systems and provide training to end-users to facilitate adoption and effective use.

Weight % Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results
35% Agentic System Development
20% Process Analysis & Optimization
20% Cross-Functional Collaboration
15% Documentation & Training
10% Monitoring & Evaluation
The Role’s Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements:
Basic understanding of programming concepts and system design principles.

Experience with low-code development platforms and tools.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.

Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Experience:
Familiarity with generative AI technologies and their applications in business process automation.

Experience in business process engineering or a related field.
Knowledge of agentic AI systems and their deployment within enterprise environments.
Computer Science Degree is preferred.

% Travel Required (Approximate): 5%

*Our Mission*

As the world’s number 1 job site\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

*Day to Day*

Conceptualize, analyze, build, test, and implement data models utilizing diverse data sets to address employment and recruiting industry challenges. Build and deploy machine learning models, testing frameworks, and data visualizations to inform decision-making and influence the product roadmap. Proactively research data sources to identify new opportunities, guiding strategic product initiatives. Evaluate data comprehensively to solve business problems, applying knowledge of human behavior and focusing on impactful outcomes rather than isolated metrics. Communicate insights, findings, and recommendations clearly and persuasively to engineering, product management, and marketing teams. Improve data quality and analysis methodologies, leveraging a deep understanding of Indeed’s business fundamentals to prioritize high-value projects. Independently design and implement end-to-end data solutions spanning multiple components. Define requirements for loosely scoped work items and partner with team leads and product managers to plan and prioritize tasks. Identify data science and product improvement opportunities, and follow through on project impact post-deployment, refining models and processes as needed. Research and incorporate new technologies, tools, and best practices to enhance repeatability, reusability, and maintainability of data science solutions. Mentor junior data scientists and engineers, sharing technical knowledge, successes, and lessons learned. Participate in interviewing and recruiting activities to build a strong data science team.

Position is in Foster City, California. Up to 100% Telecommuting from anywhere in the U.S. is permitted.

*Responsibilities*

Primary Minimum Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a closely related quantitative field
* 5 years of professional industry experience working in Data Science, Business Analytics, or Data Analysis
* Demonstrated experience performing small data modeling, using at least one of the following languages: Python, R, Julia, or Octave
* Demonstrated experience performing data mining, using at least one of the following tools: SQL, Pandas, or MongoDB
* Demonstrated experience in production development of data science solutions, using at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, or C++.

Experience may be gained concurrently.

Alternative Minimum Requirements:

* Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a closely related quantitative field
* 3 years of experience working in Data Science, Business Analytics, or Data Analysis
* Demonstrated experience performing small data modeling, using at least one of the following languages: Python, R, Julia, or Octave
* Demonstrated experience performing data mining, using at least one of the following tools: SQL, Pandas, or MongoDB
* Demonstrated experience in production development of data science solutions, using at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, or C++

Experience may be gained concurrently.

Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable.

Multiple positions available.

ARE YOU PREPARED FOR THE FUTURE? AI, AI SER!

SHARE YOUR PASSION.

Artificial Intelligence and machine learning are at the cutting edge when it comes to shaping next-gen mobility in areas like autonomous driving. But it takes real thought leadership and expertise to identify and then harness the AI trends and technologies that will transform the way people travel for good. And that’s where you come in.

BMW Shared Services is posting this position on behalf of BMW Financial Services NA, LLC.

BMW Financial Services NA, LLC was established in 1993, supporting the sales and marketing of BMW products. Subsequently, we have expanded beyond the leasing, retail and commercial financing of a traditional captive-finance company offering a broad variety of products tailored for the BMW, MINI and Rolls-Royce customer. Be a part of our exciting growth by expressing an interest in our Lead Data Scientist position located in Columbus, OH.

As a Lead Data Scientist you will be responsible for data discovery and building predictive models utilizing machine learning algorithms. The Lead Data Scientist will use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and tools to present findings in a format that is straightforward and comprehensible for non-technical stakeholders. This position will also mentor other data focused roles across the company.

WHAT AWAITS YOU.

Translate business objectives to data science problems and vice versa.
Lead analytical projects by transforming business requirements into actionable solutions, overseeing the entire project from development to implementation.
Use a combination of exploratory analysis and data mining techniques to identify and understand trends and anomalies.
Design, develop and validate predictive, prescriptive models for business use cases, problems utilizing data from multiple data sources and ensure successful adoption of the model by business.
Utilize analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets.
Partner with business stakeholders to identify, develop innovative modeling solutions and implement necessary monitoring to deploy models in production.
Use data storytelling skills to communicate deep technical outcomes from models to non-technical audiences in the organization, while leveraging data driven visuals to enhance the experience.
Utilize AWS and/or Azure cloud platforms to deploy, manage, and scale AI models and machine learning solutions, ensuring seamless integration with existing infrastructure.
Serve as the SF2-US Center of Excellence with regards to Data Science standards and processes including training and coaching on techniques and tools.
Foster model improvement efforts through communication with model users by collecting feedback and discussing it with other experts and management.

WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING.

Bachelors degree (Major in statistics, computer science, economics, engineering or similar quantitative field preferred) or equivalent experience.
5+ years of professional experience as a data scientist or similar in a corporate environment.
Experience using AI Tools; preferably Jupyter with Python, Data Robot, and SAS.
Experience using BI Tools; preferably Tableau
Experience using SQL; preferably Postgres SQL and T-SQL
3 years leading agile project delivery for analytical topics
3 years in the Financial Services or Automotive Industry (Preferred)

WHAT YOU CAN LOOK FORWARD TO.

Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
401(k) with Company match and Retirement Income Account
Employee vehicle program
Bonus eligibility
Paid Parental Leave
Generous PTO and Company paid holidays
Voluntary Benefits to fit your needs

Relocation is available for this position.

This is a hybrid role that requires regular attendance in the office.

description:
Job Description:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth. This includes our commitment to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, attracting and developing exceptional talent, supporting our teammates’ physical, emotional, and financial wellness, recognizing and rewarding performance, and how we make an impact in the communities we serve.

At Bank of America, you can build a successful career with opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact. Join us!

Job Description:
This job is responsible for ensuring operational data is fit for purpose, defining controls, and monitoring processes are in adherence to enterprise data management standards. Key responsibilities include triaging and remediating data incidents, performing data analysis, training new users, and performing impact analysis stemming from data updates. Job expectations include helping in defining access and ownership of data by domain, conducting quality control, and overseeing data maintenance.

Team Overview:

CFO Data Management (CFO DM) is responsible for ensuring data used in key internal and regulatory reports is timely, accurate, and properly controlled. This role will be responsible for supporting Treasury users of Loan products data (including consumer loan and wholesale credit). The primary functions include partnering with Treasury consumers, upstream data providers, and technology teams to research and drive resolution of data issues, document and communicate new business and data requirements, test data and functionality changes, and develop and maintain controls to ensure the integrity of the data. Additionally, the role is responsible for supporting periodic audits and exams by the internal audit and compliance organizations and various Bank regulatory agencies.

Responsibilities:

Ensures data is accurate, complete, and fit for performing data analyses through various testing procedures and data controls which help to identify business insights fit for purpose for a particular product set
Develops and executes on Enterprise Data Management policies and standards, works across teams to ensure adherence, serves as a key point of contact for all topics related to data compliance, and manages operational elements of the (Enterprise Data Strategy Governance and Operations (EDSGO) relationship
Manages data related incidents and identifies, communicates, and resolves or escalates issues as needed. Data inquiries include questions related to data issues, availability of data, and potential sourcing alternatives to inform
Develops, manages, and executes on controls, ensuring tracking, monitoring, and resolution of any control breaches with data platform
Partners with Business and Technology functions to drive the development of business and functional requirements documents and ensures strategic upstream resolution for data related incidents

Skills:

Data Collection and Entry
Data Management
Data Modeling
Issue Management
Policies, Procedures, and Guidelines Management
Analytical Thinking
Collaboration
Data Governance
Data Quality Management
Data and Trend Analysis
Business Acumen
Controls Management
Production Support
Regulatory Compliance
Solution Design

Required Qualifications:

Minimum 3 years of data analysis and product expertise within the financial industry
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail, and demonstrated experience performing complex data analysis within relational databases using SQL, Advanced MS Excel (including VBA), Toad, and/or SAS.
Knowledge/familiarity with consumer & wholesale loan products, and/or experience with regulatory or financial reporting of same

positionName: AVP, IT GenAI User Experience Development
description:
Build Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI) tools, plugins, and frameworks. Layout a framework (involving people, process, and technology) to quickly evaluate new tools and products in the GenAI domain. Design end-to-end AI architectures that align with business objectives, considering data integration, model selection, and system scalability. Lead discussions on AI solution design, providing technical leadership and insights to drive decision-making. Lead the evaluation and selection of AI technologies, frameworks, and tools to support solution development. Stay at the forefront of AI advancements, researching and evaluating emerging technologies to ensure solutions remain cutting-edge and competitive. Possess a deep understanding of the GenAI stack, including its architecture, components, and capabilities, as well as familiarity with the entire AI development lifecycle, from data preparation and model training to deployment and monitoring. Use Machine Learning (ML) and GenAI tools, such as Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock to provide a GenAI solutions. Use large language models (LLMs) and foundation models (FMs) to build GenAI applications. Collaborate with data scientists to create and fine-tune scalable ML, evaluate workflows for GenAI solutions. Serve as the Technical Lead for the GenAI Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), leveraging GenAI to enhance productivity and efficiency across all stages of the (SDLC. Guide team members in strategic planning, alignment, analysis, and execution tasks within the GenAI Center of Excellence. Build and maintain relationships with technology and business leaders from other companies to exchange best practices and innovative solutions. Work with the entire software development lifecycle; designing end-to-end software architectures that align with business objectives, considering data integration and system scalability; Amazon AWS services, including AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon RDS, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS CodePipeline; Java; Spring Boot; and, Microservices architecture.

Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field of study, plus five (5) years of experience with the entire software development lifecycle; designing end-to-end software architectures that align with business objectives, considering data integration and system scalability; Amazon AWS services, including AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon RDS, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS CodePipeline; Java; Spring Boot; and, Microservices architecture.

Lead Data Scientist

As our Lead Data Scientist, you will act as an internal business consultant to help optimize every facet of this organization. You will solve problems and answer questions – using data – for other departments to help us reduce costs, reduce errors, and be a better organization for our 17 million members.

What You’ll Do

Every day, you will help solve business problems presented to us by stakeholders using data. You will get a scenario or problem, such as, “We need to reduce cycle times,” and then pull, analyze, and interpret data relevant to that scenario.

You will pull data from SQL databases. You will analyze and interpret data using Python, R, or other tools. You will determine patterns or trends and their statistical significance to the problem. To visualize the data, you will use Tableau.

Once you have done your analysis, paired with a data engineer, you will present your findings to the stakeholder and confirm, refute or simply acknowledge a hypothesis. Your work may be implemented or may develop into something else. This role is remote, but you must be able to report to the Independence, OH office for regular collaboration days.

What You’ll Need

To thrive in this role, you must have a solid foundation of statistics and data analysis. You must be able to describe a project where you pulled data, analyzed it, identified trends or patterns, determined significance, and delivered insights or recommendations to the business. What was your approach? What tools did you use and why? Did you get to the root cause of the issue? Did you confirm or refute a hypothesis? You must be able to speak to your involvement and decisions at each stage.

For pulling data, we use SQL so you must be proficient with this tool. To curate and analyze data, we use a variety of languages and programs: Python, R, and even Excel. You can choose whatever tool helps you best, but you must be proficient in either Python or R.

Excellent communication skills and an attitude of flexibility are a must. Very often, we get into the data and some aspect takes longer than we thought, or we have to pivot and change how we approach a problem. A dashboard works better than a model, perhaps. Then you have to explain to the stakeholder or the team why you made that change or why the deliverable is taking longer than expected. It’s all about being creative in your approach and communicating that frequently and clearly to people who may be less tech or data-savvy than you.

You have worked previously with an Agile team or understand these concepts. You expect to participate in daily standup meetings, you’ll complete your projects or stories during our bimonthly sprints, and you’re ready to meet frequent deployment deadlines.

$142,300.00 - $189,200.00
Additionally, for full time positions, you will be eligible to participate in our incentive program based upon the achievement of organization, team and personal performance.

Description:

The Amivero Team

Amivero’s team of IT professionals delivers digital services that elevate the federal government, whether national security or improved government services. Our human-centered, data-driven approach is focused on truly understanding the environment and the challenge, and reimagining with our customer how outcomes can be achieved.

Our team of technologists leverage modern, agile methods to design and develop equitable, accessible, and innovative data and software services that impact hundreds of millions of people.

As a member of the Amivero team you will use your empathy for a customer’s situation, your passion for service, your energy for solutioning, and your bias towards action to bring modernization to very important, mission-critical, and public service government IT systems.

Special Requirements

US Citizenship Required to obtain Public Trust
Active DHS or CBP Public Trust clearance preferred
3+ years of relevant experience
Must be able to commute to Reston, VA 1-2x per week

The Gist…

We are looking for a Data Scientist with exceptional skill to develop machine learning and deep learning models and algorithms that create useful and actionable insight for customers. The ideal candidate should be someone who is strong mathematically; can automate scoring using machine learning techniques, can develop complex data models and methodology, build recommendation systems, and select the correct data points for analysis from the large data sets. The ideal candidate must have strong experience using a variety of mathematical/statistical/data mining/data analysis methods and tools. You are focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success for using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of the analysis.

What Your Day Might Include…

Perform knowledge elicitation from customer subject matter experts and convert that to derived algorithms
Analyze large data sets to identify actionable insights with mathematical statistical rigor
Rigorously critique and correct intermediate results to improve the algorithmic outcomes
Design and deploy deep learning algorithms and predictive models
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
Interpret and communicate results to non-technical customers
Requirements:

You’ll Bring These Qualifications…

Active DHS or CBP Public Trust clearance preferred
BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computational Linguistics, Artificial Intelligence or related field
3+ years of practical working experience in one or more of the following areas: Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning Models, Question Answering, Text Mining, Information Retrieval, Distributional Semantics, Data Science, Knowledge Engineering
Experience using a variety of mathematical, statistical, data mining, and data analysis methods/tools
Interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with various clients in order to explain and elaborate on technical details
Experience in productization of machine learning algorithms and the ability to deliver data science components that are part of successful deliverables
Working knowledge of general machine learning algorithms and NLP, Graph Theory, and Network Analysis
Fluency in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, R, etc.)
Experience with statistical data analysis, experimental design, and hypotheses validation
Experience with database querying like SQL
Readiness to collaborate with engineering teams, product teams, and customers to develop prototypes and software products
Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) experience

EOE/M/F/VET/DISABLED

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Amivero complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Job Description

Who you are:

You enjoy building machine learning models and doing advanced statistical analyses. You enjoy combing through large data sets and finding patterns within the noise. You’re autonomous and able to acquire new skills to solve a problem. You’re always looking to innovate current processes and you get excited when tackling problems you haven’t seen before. You have a strong analytics and programming background and are ready to start applying this to the world of data science.

What you’ll do:

As a Lead Data Scientist you will work on building/evaluating learning models to predict core business results. You’ll derive impactful insights from data to drive intelligence for Unified and its clients. You will work with your fellow data science team members to define and scope data science solutions to solve complex problems. You will help build, improve, and test robust statistical and machine learning solutions that will drive impact throughout the organization.

Need to have:

3-5+ years experience building Machine Learning models

3-5+ years advanced programming skills in Python

1-2+ years LLM prompt engineering and RAG experience

Proficiency in SQL and knowledge of RDBMs like Postgres and Redshift

Experience with ETL processing and data wrangling including fetching, munging, cleaning, pivoting, analyzing, aggregating, distributing, and visualizing

Basic knowledge of statistics, algorithms, data structures, and machine learning

Nice to have:

Experience with digital advertising technology

Experience with AWS

Experience with Spark and the big data ecosystem

Experience using Git and the Unix command-line

Familiarity with Airflow and Docker

Familiarity calling RESTful web services, specifically social APIs (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.)

Familiarity with BI tools (Tableau, Sisense)

Bachelor’s or higher in a quantitative field

About Us

Unified stands at the forefront of empowering marketers to make informed and impactful decisions through our industry-exclusive business intelligence platform, purposefully designed for social advertising. With a wealth of experience in collecting and enriching over 3 billion dollars of social investment data, we are fervently committed to providing Fortune 2000 brands and agencies with greater transparency into their diverse teams, tools, and strategies. At the heart of our offerings is the Unified Platform and service teams, meticulously crafted to ensure data quality, optimize investments, and address critical business inquiries. As a leading provider of advertising services, Unified takes a comprehensive approach to paid social advertising, boasting a best-in-class team of digital experts utilizing purpose-built technology to deliver operational excellence and holistic insights across major social platforms. We firmly believe that the best marketing insights drive optimal performance, and at Unified, we seamlessly deliver both. With industry-leading media experts supported by robust data and technology, we have over a decade of experience in managed service partnerships with some of the world's largest brands, maintaining an unwavering focus on digital advertising services and technology. Our proprietary technology provides our internal team and customers with a strategic and holistic real-time view of their digital investments. Pioneering paid social over 11 years ago, Unified holds a unique position as one of the select partners with direct API access to major platforms such as Meta, X, Snapchat, Pinterest, YouTube, LinkedIn, TikTok, and Reddit. Join Unified as we continue to redefine the landscape of digital advertising through innovation, expertise, and cutting-edge technology.

This is a remote position.

Your Quest: Help make a big difference in healthcare access

At Quest Analytics our team members can fulfill their quest to work in an innovative, collaborative, challenging and flexible environment supportive of personal growth every day. The team is driven to make healthcare more accessible for all Americans.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst specializing in health plan network analytics to join our team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in advancing the intelligence and precision of health plan network analytics. This position focuses on working directly with large-scale healthcare datasets—including claims data, provider directory files, and provider network files—to uncover trends, measure network performance, and support the development of data-driven strategies for provider network optimization and improve network performance.

You will be responsible for identifying and quantifying network challenges, conducting deep analytical investigations, and applying structured data exploration to generate meaningful, context-rich insights. This role requires a strong command of data tools, rigorous attention to data quality, and a passion for using data and analytics to solve complex problems in healthcare delivery.

Ideal candidates are curious, methodical, and driven by a desire to understand the “why” behind the data. Success in this role depends on your ability to work independently with complex data inputs, apply critical thinking, and continually refine methods for extracting value from provider network-related datasets.

#LI-Remote

In this role you will:
Data Ingestion and Cleansing:
Acquire and ingest relevant data sets, including claims data and provider network files.
Implement robust data cleansing procedures to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Data Enrichment and Analysis:
Enhance datasets by integrating additional relevant information.
Analyze complex datasets using a variety of tools, with a particular emphasis on SQL, Excel, and Databricks.

Continuously explore novel approaches and methodologies to address healthcare network challenges.
Contribute to the development of cutting-edge solutions that differentiate our company in the market.

Be part of an amazing story.

Macy’s is more than just a store. We’re a story. One that’s captured the hearts and minds of America for more than 160 years. A story about innovations and traditions…about inspiring stores and irresistible products…about the excitement of the Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks, and the wonder of the Thanksgiving Day Parade. We’ve been part of memorable moments and milestones for countless customers and colleagues. Those stories are part of what makes this such a special place to work.

Job Overview

The Lead, Data Scientist plays a critical role in advancing Macy’s enterprise-wide data and analytics strategy. This role designs and deploys advanced analytics and machine learning models that drive business decisions and customer-centric outcomes. By embedding data science into high-impact use cases, this role helps accelerate innovation and deliver measurable value across the organization.

What You Will Do

Design, develop, and implement scalable analytics models and machine learning solutions for priority business use cases.
Collaborate with business units to generate hypotheses, define data needs, and deliver actionable insights.
Build predictive models and high-impact visualizations to support decision-making.
Partner with Data Engineering and Architecture teams to implement data pipelines and enterprise-wide data assets.
Ensure analytics solutions comply with standards and best practices in methodology and coding.
Support the scale-up and rollout of analytics applications in collaboration with Technology teams.
Foster a data-driven culture by mentoring colleagues and promoting analytics literacy across the organization.
Stay current on emerging data science techniques and tools to continuously improve capabilities.
Foster an environment of acceptance and respect that strengthens relationships, and ensures authentic connections with colleagues, customers, and communities.
In addition to the essential duties mentioned above, other duties may be assigned.

Skills You Will Need

Advanced Analytics & Modeling: Designs and deploys predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques. Skilled in tools such as Python, R, SQL, or similar platforms used for data analysis and modeling.

Data Engineering Collaboration: Works with engineering teams to build scalable data pipelines and reusable data assets.

Business Partnership: Translates complex analytics into business value through collaboration with cross-functional teams.

Cloud Computing: Applies data science techniques using platforms such as Google Cloud Platform.

Communication: Delivers clear, compelling insights through written, verbal, and visual storytelling.

Agile Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves data issues quickly to maintain momentum on analytics initiatives. Comfortable working under shifting priorities and adapting to business needs in real time.

Curiosity & Innovation – Demonstrates a continuous learning mindset and passion for exploring new approaches to data science and analytics.

Who You Are

Candidates with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply. PhD preferred.
5–8 years of experience applying data science in business environments.
Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision.
Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

What We Can Offer You

Join a team where work is as rewarding as it is fun! We offer a dynamic, inclusive environment with competitive pay and benefits. Enjoy comprehensive health and wellness coverage and a 401(k) match to invest in your future. Prioritize your well-being with paid time off and eight paid holidays. Grow your career with continuous learning and leadership development. Plus, build community by joining one of our Colleague Resource Groups and make a difference through our volunteer opportunities.

Some additional benefits we offer include:

Merchandise discounts
Performance-based incentives
Annual merit review
Employee Assistance Program with mental health counseling and legal/financial advice
Tuition reimbursement

Access the full menu of benefits offerings here.

About Us

This is a great time to join Macy’s! Whether you’re helping a customer find the perfect gift, streamlining operations in one of our distribution centers, enhancing our online shopping experience, buying in-style and on-trend merchandise to outfit our customers, or designing a balloon for the Thanksgiving Day Parade, we offer unique opportunities to be part of some of the most memorable moments in people’s lives.

Join us and help write the next chapter in our story - apply today!

Who are we, and what do we do?
At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. No matter your role, you will be part of a team that is building the future of agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.

Corteva Agriscience has exciting opportunities for a senior data scientist/statistician. Successful candidates will join a strong, globally distributed Data Science team that develops and applies innovative methods and tools to deliver insights for R&D. The candidates will partner with leading toxicologists, environmental scientists, and human health risk assessors to support our efforts in regulatory approval. The position will be in Indianapolis, IN.

What You Will do:

Provide statistical input to the design, analysis, reporting and interpretation of data.
Collaborate with cross-functional and inter-disciplinary teams for problem solving, addressing complex data analytics and statistical questions, and interpretation of complex datasets.
Effectively explain research methodology and statistical analysis as they relate to research outcomes.
Collaborate with the research staff to address complex data analytics and statistical questions.
Collaborate with principal investigators, co-investigators, and research staff in the preparation of manuscripts, reports, and presentation.

What Skills You Need:

MS with 10+ years or Ph.D. with 5+ years in a Statistical or related discipline.
Ability to plan, develop, and execute biostatistical components of research and development projects.
Strong knowledge of experimental design, generalized linear models and nonlinear models, as well as model selection and validation.
Ability to work both independently and within a multidisciplinary team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to successfully collaborate and lead projects with colleagues from diverse technical background.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, flexibility, and attention to details.

Skills that are nice to have:

Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure that scientifically rigorous experimental designs and statistical methods are implemented.
Experience in identifying and solving problems related to experimental design and statistical analyses for regulatory approval using classical and modern statistical methodologies.
High level of knowledge in chemical or seed regulatory methods and execution.
Prior experience in global regulatory submissions.
Familiarity with modeling biological, cellular, or ecological data.
Some experience in data mining using machine learning algorithms.

Join the Clean Energy Revolution

Become a Data Science Senior Specialist at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll be responsible for working closely with internal clients, Subject Matter Experts, information architects, data engineers, process leads, project/program managers, and other teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make data informed business decisions.

You will work in the Business Intelligence Center within Customer Service, developing predictive analytics solutions. You'll support internal clients by solving complex problems and enhancing business and customer experiences. Your tasks include analyzing large data sets, building advanced analytical models, and generating actionable insights for decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, leveraging advanced statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and AI technology to solve real-world problems.

You will be accountable for partnering with Organization Unit (OU) clients to understand business problems, identify opportunities for improvement, and incorporate analytics solutions into business processes, to ensure analytics solutions deliver positive business value and are directly associated with OU goals. As a Data Science Senior Specialist, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?

Responsibilities
Engages diverse stakeholders including data scientists, business clients, data engineers, SMEs and team members to define solutions to complex business problems requiring advanced analytics and modeling
Develops predictive and prescriptive data models using machine learning, statistical modeling and other advanced techniques to uncover insights that improve data-driven decision making across the organization
Identifies high-value use cases across business functions and domains to apply artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science to solve previously intractable business problems
Translates specific business challenges into well-defined objectives, requirements and success criteria for developing appropriate AI/ML models and solutions
Designs, develops and thoroughly evaluates innovative AI/ML models leveraging techniques like neural networks, deep learning and reinforcement learning to create predictive capabilities
Applies cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and data mining techniques to extract key insights and make accurate predictions from large, varied and complex datasets
Continuously monitors and enhances AI/ML models for improved performance; tracks key metrics to validate models against desired outcomes
Develops AI/ML solutions following established processes and model governance practices for ethics, explainability, reproducibility and ongoing maintenance
Researches and evaluates new and emerging AI/ML tools, techniques and technologies; makes recommendations on their potential business application and impact
Develops peer relationships and participates in industry groups and events to stay current on data science
A material job duty of all positions within the Company is ensuring the protection of all its physical, financial and cybersecurity assets, and properly accessing and managing private customer data, proprietary information, confidential medical records, and other types of highly sensitive information and data with the highest standards of conduct and integrity.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or Business Analytics.
Three or more years of experience in data analytics related work.*PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, business analytics = 2 years of experience credit.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience coding in Proficiency in Python, or Scala, SQL, SAS etc
Experience using the following database systems: MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MSSQL. Big Data Analytics: Hadoop environment, Hive, Pig or Spark.
Broad understanding of the electric utility industry and its regulatory environment.
Three or more years of experience using machine Learning methods such as deep learning, Bayesian methods, time series analysis, boosting, and bagging.
Two or more years of experience formulating high-level business goals as data science problems and identifying appropriate machine learning or data mining algorithms to solve various electric utility problems.
Capable of learning from state-of-the-art technical articles and reports. Has the ability to tailor state-of-the-art algorithms to solve the problem at hand, Has the ability to create insightful interpretations of the results.
Ability to effectively communicate technical content to non-technical audience at all levels, including individual contributor, frontline manager, middle management, and executives.
Two or more years of experience working with GCP, Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.

Additional Information

This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to work and reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage. The work mode can be changed based on business needs.

ENTERPRISE DATA SCIENTIST
Department of Finance and Administration
STRATEGIC TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS
Nashville, TN
Salary: $8,534.00 - $11,076.00
Closing Date: 07/07/2025

This position is designated as hybrid.

Background Check: This position requires CJIS & FTI fingerprints. This position also requires a criminal background check. Therefore, you may be required to provide information about your criminal history to be considered for this position.

Who we are and what we do:

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, developing predictive models, and providing actionable insights to enhance business outcomes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to improve operational efficiency, strengthen security and compliance, and enhance data governance and quality.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Engineering, Analysis & Modeling:

Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets from multiple sources.
Architect and implement end-to-end AI pipelines, from data ingestion and preprocessing to model deployment and performance monitoring.
Utilize large language models (LLMs) and generative AI frameworks to automate workflows, enhance user experiences, and create intelligent digital assistants.
Integrate AI solutions into business systems and processes, enabling real-time insights and adaptive decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify AI use cases, define success metrics, and deliver measurable business impact.
Leverage deep learning, NLP, computer vision, and other AI techniques where applicable.
Identify opportunities to automate workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
Use AI/ML techniques to improve security measures and regulatory compliance.
Develop and maintain data pipelines for real-time and batch processing.
Ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance with governance policies.
Use cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) for scalable deployment.

Security, Data Governance & Compliance:

Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with industry standards ((DMBOK).
Collaborate with IT and data teams to improve data quality and governance.
Support regulatory reporting and audit requirements.
Ensure models align with security policies and compliance standards (GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2).
Implement robust access controls and data anonymization techniques.
Work closely with data governance teams to enhance data protection strategies.

Business Insights & Reporting:

Translate complex data findings into actionable insights for stakeholders.
Gather, analyze, and interpret business data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Build dashboards and visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries.
Conduct gap analysis and recommend process improvements.
Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in workflows.
Conduct A/B testing and statistical analysis to measure business impact.

Minimum Qualifications:

Collaboration, Communication and Project Planning:

Work closely with business leaders, engineers, and analysts to define data-driven strategies.
Present findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling manner.
Lead end-to-end data projects, from requirement gathering to implementation.
Define project scope, goals, and deliverables in alignment with business objectives.
Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and resource allocation strategies.
Identify project risks and develop mitigation strategies.
Utilize project management software (Jira, Asana, Trello, MS Project) for tracking progress.
Ensure project documentation is maintained and accessible.
Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet quality standards.

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field:

5+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role.
Strong background designing, developing and optimizing scalable data solutions using Google BigQuery and GCP.
Must be able to obtain DoD clearance.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker etc.).
Knowledge of data governance, compliance, and security best practices.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Job Description

DNA Data Scientist, Archer Daniels Midland Company, Erlanger, KY.
Use large data sets to find opportunities for manufacturing and process optimization and use models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Utilize a variety of data mining and analysis methods, tools, models, algorithms, and simulations to build, implement, and run comprehensive data-driven solutions. Drive business results with data-based insights. Discover solutions hidden in large data sets and work with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Use advanced mathematical models, operations research techniques, and simulation to deliver insights, recommendations, and solutions to address manufacturing and business challenges. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Manage individual analyses and provide clear communications of findings and recommendations. Structure analyses and develop insights. Organize materials to facilitate reviews, quality checks, and presentation of findings and present findings to leadership.
40 hrs/week, Mon-Fri, 8:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.

Master’s degree or foreign equivalent degree in Engineering (any), Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field, and two (2) years of related work experience.
Must have two (2) years of experience with/in:
• Performing data mining, data analytics, and predictive modeling initiatives using Python, SAS, SPSS, R, or an equivalent analytics package;

• Variety of machine learning techniques, such as clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, and their real-world advantages/drawbacks; and
• Advanced statistical techniques and concepts, such as regression, properties of distributions, statistical testing, and proper usage, and experience with their applications.
Telecommuting permitted up to one (1) day per week.

Join the Clean Energy Revolution

Become a Data Science Senior Specialist at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll be responsible for working closely with internal clients, Subject Matter Experts, information architects, data engineers, process leads, project/program managers, and other teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make data informed business decisions.

You will work in the Business Intelligence Center within Customer Service, developing predictive analytics solutions. You’ll support internal clients by solving complex problems and enhancing business and customer experiences. Your tasks include analyzing large data sets, building advanced analytical models, and generating actionable insights for decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, leveraging advanced statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and AI technology to solve real-world problems.

You will be accountable for partnering with Organization Unit (OU) clients to understand business problems, identify opportunities for improvement, and incorporate analytics solutions into business processes, to ensure analytics solutions deliver positive business value and are directly associated with OU goals. As a Data Science Senior Specialist, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?

Responsibilities
Engages diverse stakeholders including data scientists, business clients, data engineers, SMEs and team members to define solutions to complex business problems requiring advanced analytics and modeling
Develops predictive and prescriptive data models using machine learning, statistical modeling and other advanced techniques to uncover insights that improve data-driven decision making across the organization
Identifies high-value use cases across business functions and domains to apply artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science to solve previously intractable business problems
Translates specific business challenges into well-defined objectives, requirements and success criteria for developing appropriate AI/ML models and solutions
Designs, develops and thoroughly evaluates innovative AI/ML models leveraging techniques like neural networks, deep learning and reinforcement learning to create predictive capabilities
Applies cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and data mining techniques to extract key insights and make accurate predictions from large, varied and complex datasets
Continuously monitors and enhances AI/ML models for improved performance; tracks key metrics to validate models against desired outcomes
Develops AI/ML solutions following established processes and model governance practices for ethics, explainability, reproducibility and ongoing maintenance
Researches and evaluates new and emerging AI/ML tools, techniques and technologies; makes recommendations on their potential business application and impact
Develops peer relationships and participates in industry groups and events to stay current on data science
A material job duty of all positions within the Company is ensuring the protection of all its physical, financial and cybersecurity assets, and properly accessing and managing private customer data, proprietary information, confidential medical records, and other types of highly sensitive information and data with the highest standards of conduct and integrity.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or Business Analytics.
Three or more years of experience in data analytics related work.*PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, business analytics = 2 years of experience credit.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience coding in Proficiency in Python, or Scala, SQL, SAS etc
Experience using the following database systems: MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MSSQL. Big Data Analytics: Hadoop environment, Hive, Pig or Spark.
Broad understanding of the electric utility industry and its regulatory environment.
Three or more years of experience using machine Learning methods such as deep learning, Bayesian methods, time series analysis, boosting, and bagging.
Two or more years of experience formulating high-level business goals as data science problems and identifying appropriate machine learning or data mining algorithms to solve various electric utility problems.
Capable of learning from state-of-the-art technical articles and reports. Has the ability to tailor state-of-the-art algorithms to solve the problem at hand, Has the ability to create insightful interpretations of the results.
Ability to effectively communicate technical content to non-technical audience at all levels, including individual contributor, frontline manager, middle management, and executives.
Two or more years of experience working with GCP, Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.

Additional Information

This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to work and reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage. The work mode can be changed based on business needs.
